gov.usgs.anss.smgetter

Class ProcessQube

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.smgetter.ProcessQube

  • public final class ProcessQube
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the main() class for the SMGetter project. It can use EIDS or PDL to get QUBE messages and process for strong motion fetches and to run PGM processing. The Qube are processed by an instance of this class which uses :
    1) the FetchListBuilder class to make fetchlist entries from events in QUBE format,
    2) one StrongMotionBuilder to build PGM table entries from events in QUBE format,
    3) two PGMProcess threads are started which scan the PGM table for various time intervals and process the PGM when the time series are available.

    PDL sometimes hangs up. To prevent unobserved periods where events are not processed there is a Heartbeat listener created which counts heart beats (every 5 minutes). Every 10 minutes the program will force itself to restart if 1) There are no heart beats and the number of PDL event messages processed is zero, 2) The last event messages processed is more than an hour old. 

     switch args         Description
 -dbg             More log output
 -n    N1N2N3     N1 and N2 and N3 are networks to include in the processing (def=USNCBKCINMAKATPTPRUULDUW)
 -pdl             Use PDL mode
 -pdldir dir      Override the directory for PDL p
 -sendto ip:ip    Send the XML files to the listed IP addresses (def=136.177.24.98, 136.177.24.99) passed to PGMProcess
 -nofetch         This instance does not generate fetchlist entries (useful at contingency site!)
 -noproc          Do not start threads to process created PGM (only the creation of fetches and PGMs is done, good when testing PDL/PGM generation)
 -nosmb           Do not create StrongMotionBuilder to create PGM entries.
 -pdlhost ip      The primary pdl host (def=ehppdl1)
 -pdlport nn      The PDL port (def =39977)
 -pdlalt  ip      The PDL alternate host (def=ehppdl2)
 -pdlfile filename PDL storage (def=embeddedStorage)
